content.p: The recommended specification for devices needed to support many activities within the Department of Architecture and Built Environment are outlined by Digital and Technology Services (DTS). It is also recommended that you have a webcam and microphone for participation in video conferences and online group meetings plus a keyboard and mouse to enable you to work effectively with certain software. These requirements are largely in line with requirements that the university recommends in general. However, some of our programmes of study recommend enhancements or additions to these requirements. This is because you will be working with certain software packages and will be carrying out digital analysis and/or design. The use of MacBooks and similar devices is not recommended as running the software can be problematical with the Apple operating systems. For all DABE students the following capabilities arenâ€™t essential but could help improve your comfort while studying: Architecture and Built Environment Visit our contact us page to find the most relevant contact details for your query
